  â”‚ ## âœ… Project Created: test-blog

  â”‚ ### Project Structure Created:
  â”‚ ```
  â”‚ test-blog/
  â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ project.md          # Project overview and tracking

  â”‚ â””â”€â”€ research/           # Research materials
  â”‚ ```
  â”‚ 
  â”‚ ### What's in project.md:
  â”‚ - Project intent and goal
  â”‚ - Project status tracking
  â”‚ - Directory structure documentation
  â”‚ - Placeholders for sources, targets, and rules
  â”‚ - Recommended next steps for getting started
  â”‚ 
  â”‚ ### Recommended Next Steps:
  â”‚ 
  â”‚ 1. **Add source materials** (example Python blog posts or documentation):
  â”‚    ```bash
  â”‚    kurt content add <url>
  â”‚    ```
  â”‚ 
  â”‚ 2. **Extract writing rules** from existing content:
  â”‚    ```bash
  â”‚    writing-rules-skill publisher --auto-discover
  â”‚    writing-rules-skill style --type technical-docs --auto-discover
  â”‚    ```
  â”‚ 
  â”‚ 3. **Create your first blog post**:
  â”‚    ```bash
  â”‚    content-writing-skill outline test-blog <article-name>
  â”‚    content-writing-skill draft test-blog <article-name>
  â”‚    ```
  â”‚ 
  â”‚ The project is now ready to use! You can resume it anytime with `/resume-project test-blog`.
